definitions.definition: A rampart of earth, stones etc. built up for defensive purposes.
A structure built for defense surrounding a city, castle etc.
definitions.example: The town wall was surrounded by a moat.

definitions.definition: Each of the substantial structures acting either as the exterior of or divisions within a structure.
definitions.example: We're adding another wall in this room during the remodeling.  The wind blew against the walls of the tent.

definitions.definition: A point of desperation.
A point of defeat or extinction.
An impediment to free movement.
definitions.example: A wall of police officers met the protesters before they reached the capitol steps.

definitions.definition: A type of butterfly (Lasiommata megera).
(often in combination) A barrier.
A barrier to vision.
Something with the apparent solidity and dimensions of a building wall.
definitions.example: a wall of sound;  a wall of water

definitions.definition: A divisive or containing structure in an organ or cavity.
(auction) A fictional bidder used to increase the price at an auction.
A doctor who tries to admit as few patients as possible.
A line of defenders set up between an opposing free-kick taker and the goal.
A personal notice board listing messages of interest to a particular user.
To enclose with, or as if with, a wall or walls.
definitions.example: He walled the study with books.

definitions.definition: To boil.
To well, as water; spring.
A spring of water.
A kind of knot often used at the end of a rope; a wall knot or wale.
To make a wall knot on the end of (a rope).
